For those of you that believe in a "living" constitution...why don't you check out what Justice Scalia has to say. It is good to see the other side of the story...see if you can refute some of his points.
 
 http://www.c-span.org/homepage.asp?Cat=Series&Code=AC&ShowVidNum=6&Rot_Cat_CD=AC&Rot_HT=206&Rot_WD=&ShowVidDays=100&ShowVidDesc=&ArchiveDays=100
 
 It is an hour long, but I watched it..and actually realized a few new things.
 
 Just if you were wondering, I also listened to Judge Breyer too and will be listening to a few more later on.

look at the use of foreign law in citing american court cases too
 
 http://www.c-span.org/videoarchives.asp?CatCodePairs=Series,AC&ArchiveDays=100
 
 should be the last one on there...Breyer vs Scalia

If you listen to those clips...first one around the 30min mark...you will see the flaws in the living constitution that gave the RIGHT TO ABORTION...This is important for our debate (the legal side). He says that we need to view the constitution as it was written when it was written. A very good well spoken man. Check out Breyer too...for the opposite view emoticon_rolleyes

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Scalia and the Living Constitution
